alert.note: Alert for Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 4:40PM EDT until July 14 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHEASTERN HIGHLAND AND SOUTH CENTRAL PENDLETON COUNTIES... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms had produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The heaviest rain has ended, although additional showers may affect portions of the area. It will take time for the runoff to work downstream. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Doe Hill... Palo Alto... Harper... This includes the following Flood Prone Roads: Route 30 along Brushy Fork... US Highway 220 at East Dry Run... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
